Name: The Writhing Gullet
Description: You swim through a foul labyrinth of passages and intestines. Your eyes sting with every stroke. The water grows ever more bilious.

DefaultEvent.Name: Down, down...
DefaultEvent.Description: Festering bubbles burst against your skin. Every kick and stroke is a struggle.

ChildBranches.Name: Keep swimming down into the Gullet
ChildBranches.Description: Anything could have found its way down here. Or anyone. [This will require increasing numbers of Phosphorescent Nodules. You may encounter different things on different trips, but can only collect one treasure per dive.]

ChildBranches.Name: Leave the Writhing Gullet
ChildBranches.Description:
This have gone deep enough. You can return later.
[Abandon your dive.]

DefaultEvent.Name: Choking in the darkness
DefaultEvent.Description: Unbreathable! A persistent viscosity pushes you down, towards the digestive juices of the hideous stomach below. Only frantic kicking allows you to struggle free and rise again. Gripping tight to a stomach hair to get your strength back, one thing is clear - this is as as low as you can go.

ChildBranches.Name: Try, fruitlessly, to dive deeper
ChildBranches.Description:
You are so deep that the water is thick, airless, acidic. There can be nothing below.
[You have gone as far as you may.]

DefaultEvent.Name: Old habits
DefaultEvent.Description: There: the bright light of your zubmarine's main beam. The airlock. Home.

ChildBranches.Name: Drowning!
ChildBranches.Description: No. Not drowning exactly. You have air. But the water is too heavy. Your lungs scream with the effort. You have to get back to the zub!

DefaultEvent.Name: Lost in the Maw
DefaultEvent.Description:
Blood flows uncontrollably from your wounds. You are too weak to swim. Too weak to keep forcing this vile water through your lungs. 

You drift lower, dragged by the subtle currents to a bilious grave. All around, eyeless things of bleached white flesh and serrated hooked teeth ooze from the walls.

DefaultEvent.Name: Morbid anthropology
DefaultEvent.Description:
The placing is deliberate. The bodies are firmly attached. An old ritual, from an earlier age of Nook? You cannot tell, but it is a matter that London's eminent scholars will no doubt be interested to debate. At least until the brandy runs out. 
[This concludes this dive into the Gullet.]

ChildBranches.Name: Investigate an ossuary of bone
ChildBranches.Description: What looks like horizontal ribs line this part of the stomach. Skeletal remnants hang from them.

DefaultEvent.Name: A glimpse of the beast
DefaultEvent.Description: You rest your hand against the pulsing flesh... and are no longer yourself. You are vast - larger than any beast or building. You are hungry - you could devour whole fleets and not be sated. You are lonely. You are far from home. You are imprisoned in the belly of a tiny world, sealed away from the blazing stars, and the singing nowhere-winds, and the edgeless, echoing freedom of - You manage to drag your hand away. Your own, familiar thoughts return. The subcutaneous light has faded, and it is dark once more in the belly of the beast. The great, dozing, mournful, hungry beast. You feel a sudden preference to be anywhere except its stomach. [This concludes this dive into the Gullet. You have collected the most valuable treasure to be found down here, and will not be able to do so again.]

ChildBranches.Name: Investigate a biological peculiarity
ChildBranches.Description: A throbbing luminescence runs just behind the membrane of the gullet, here. When you reach towards it, your hair slowly begins to stand on end.

DefaultEvent.Name: Spirited resistance
DefaultEvent.Description: Nookdivers are accustomed to ambush. In this case, while you struggle with one, the other swims away. Then, from nowhere, she strikes, emerging from the darkness like a torpedo and slamming you into a jagged-edged tooth jutting from the gullet wall. She and her compatriot swim swiftly away.

ChildBranches.Name: Ambush a pair of Nookdivers
ChildBranches.Description: Their attention is focused on the treasures they've recovered from below.

DefaultEvent.Name: A thrashing boil
DefaultEvent.Description: You push through the tear into the fleshy cavity behind. A hundred child-sized maggots infest it; eyeless, bleached white, burrowed in with their teeth. In the middle of their number is a skeleton, picked clean, lit by a cluster of discarded nodules. Before you can investigate it, though, the maggots detect you. They boil towards you as you squeeze back out, their ragged teeth snapping at your retreat.

ChildBranches.Name: Something glimmers in the darkness
ChildBranches.Description: Light. Through a tear in the flesh wall.

DefaultEvent.Name: A trap...
DefaultEvent.Description: The coffin is embedded hard in the wall between teeth and stiff, probing hairs. The hairs coil around your arm as you pull at your prize, raising blistered welts in your skin. Behind you, a grinning ambusher swims forwards, a bone claw nestled between thumb and forefinger. You heave yourself free of the hairs, leaving skin and blood behind, and make your escape.

ChildBranches.Name: Something glimmers in the darkness
ChildBranches.Description: A brass handle on a casket. You aren't very deep - why hasn't someone already claimed it?

DefaultEvent.Name: Carried away
DefaultEvent.Description: The current pulls you through narrowing innards. The water sours. Your descent slows.

ChildBranches.Name: Slipstream!
ChildBranches.Description: There is no treasure here, but a swift downward current promises a faster journey.

DefaultEvent.Name: A painful adventure
DefaultEvent.Description: The ship is pinned only loosely to the great teeth. As you are exploring, it shifts. It doesn't fall far, or very quickly, but it's enough to dislodge a Khaganian captain's chest of drawers and send it crashing slowly into you. It takes long, painful minutes to free your crushed leg.

ChildBranches.Name: Explore a lost ship
ChildBranches.Description: It looks like a Khanate vessel, caught upside down.

DefaultEvent.Name: Perhaps the worst idea ever had at zee
DefaultEvent.Description: The worm writhes! It grinds you into the gullet's wall, the ridges of its slick length grating against you. You squirm free, kicking for safety as you asses whether it broke any of your ribs.

ChildBranches.Name: Climb down an undulating tapeworm
ChildBranches.Description: This could be a quick way into the depths. Or at least into a prominent entry in the upcoming second volume of The Worst Ways To Die At Zee.

DefaultEvent.Name: Jonah, lost
DefaultEvent.Description: You catch up with the Nookdiver, but he shrinks away in fear. You try to explain yourself in a few gestures. Before you have even finished the first, he has fled.

ChildBranches.Name: Rescue a lost Nookdiver
ChildBranches.Description: His light blinks at you through the tunnels below. He seems to be in some distress.

DefaultEvent.Name: A mystery for someone else
DefaultEvent.Description: A fierce current tugs at you as you draw close. The tether tying one of the bodies to its weights snaps, and it is dragged away into the dark, bashing against the gullet's walls. You sensibly withdraw.

ChildBranches.Name: Investigate a throng of Nook's dead
ChildBranches.Description: Here, in a bend in the gullet, a number of zeeweed-wrapped mummies sway in the current.
